name: SeaCrest OceanFront Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay here. The pool and spas were nice and the free breakfast was very good too. Would definitely recommend. I felt completely rested on leaving and found the guest services staff very helpful (e.g. late check out organised with no hassle etc)
reviews.title: Very pleasant; great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked one night here as part of our trip from San Francisco to Los Angeles and i wished we had planned an extra night.
reviews.title: Amazing Location, great staff.

reviews.text: The check in was quite sweet, there was a team of three young guys on reception (one new and two experienced). They were really informative and made the check in a smooth and effortless process. We had a suite on the far left hand corner of the hotel and the view was just amazing. We had planned to go out for dinner but because of the beautiful sunset, we ended up getting some food delivered to the room and using the hotel romm service to have some wine also sent up. It was my wifes 50th birthday trip and the hotel left a lovely gift in the room - thank you.
reviews.title: Beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only slight downside was the breakfast. Not enough space for all the guests and the choice was limited.
reviews.title: Joyful 30th Anniversary at Exceptional SeaCrest OceanFront Hotel

reviews.text: Apart from that, this was a lovely stay in a great location with lovely staff.
reviews.title: The staff, location, and views made it an amazing stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 3rd hotel on our road trip and we were very impressed, the staff were great and helpful. We had a room upgrade as it was our friends birthday and the room was fantastic, it was clean and comfy the room view was of the pool and you can see the sea which was beautiful as we had a terraced to sit out on. The room has a coffee machine but you could get tea and other drinks in the reception which is free. The hotel also offers free breakfast which was basic but nice (first hotel to offer on our road trip) and we had free Wi-Fi.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: There are a number of places to eat in the area and most places are walkable. The hotel is in a great location for shopping too as they have clothing outlets.
reviews.title: Another night on the road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a good place to stop over on our motorcycle road trip. The grounds, pool and beach views were great and helped to unwind after riding the Big Sur. The breakfast area was rather crowded and we ended up eating ours in a very cold and draughty corridoor. Unlike Bob J, we had an excellent meal at Marie Calenders next door.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location Right on the Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night, our room was ready when we arrived around mid day, which was great, the reception girls were very friendly and helpful. Our rooms were spacious and clean, we had a ground floor room with a patio just overlooking the pool/sea area, if we went back we would pay extra for a Sea View as the scenery is amazing. The Beach area is good, though do be aware as there are a number of steps to go down if you have walking difficulties. From the beach you can walk into Pismo (around 20 mins) where there are plenty of restaurants and a couple of bars. We were lucky enough to see Dolphins in the sea and they swam fairly close to the shore line which was wonderful and the morning we were leaving we spotted Wales out in the distance. The pool area was very pretty with plenty of sun beds and fresh towels supplied, we also enjoyed the use of the jacuzzi's which were lovely and warm. We were told breakfast was continental so didn't expect too much, but were in for a great surprise, as there was a good choice of cereals, numerous breads and bagels, with both savoury and sweet fillings along with fruit and yoghurt, so something for everyone, you can also enjoy your breakfast out on the terrace where they had fire heaters dotted around to take the chill off. The only thing we though that let this hotel down was that there was no bar facilities, as we would have liked to have stayed in the hotel with a few drinks in the evening, so that we could soak up the beautiful surroundings, but the hotel staff pointed out there was a restaurant about a 10 minute walk down the road, which we went to overlooking the sea, we did go here and all had a lovely meal. It's a pity we couldn't have stayed here a little longer.
reviews.title: Road trip

reviews.text: Hotel was lovely. Very comfortable and clean rooms. Check in staff were good. Coffee available in reception whenever you want it. Beautiful views. Sat up on the roof terrace with my husband nice and peaceful with lovely views. Walked along the beach to the pier then had fish and chips. Lovely place but very busy.
reviews.title: Great location, hotel average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent two nights here with ten other friends who occupied other rooms. We were extremely pleased with our choice after there was not enough room for us all at the Kon Tiki Inn. (And now we're really pleased that there wasn't!)
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.text: Our room had a balcony and a superb view of Pismo Beach and the ocean (see attached photo). We made good use of the pool and the hot tubs plus we really enjoyed being able to access the beach directly from the hotel with just a ten minute walk to the boardwalk.
reviews.title: We "heart" SeaCrest!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The simple breakfast was good and the outside patio seating area had fire-pit burners that enabled you to sit out even if there was a chill in the air.
reviews.title: Great Views, Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The location makes for easy access from the Highway and good restaurants are within walking distance. The service in the hotel was professional and friendly and the parking was easy.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We felt that this hotel was great value for money and all of my party would have been happy to have stayed much longer. Five out of five!
reviews.title: Oceanfront location; can't beat it!
Aweful smell!
reviews.text: I have been to Pismo Beach before and have never stayed at this hotel but the whole area smelled nasty, like a mix of rotting and fish. I realize that Pismo is next to the ocean but this was hardcore, my wife felt like she was going to pass out. Also a resturant named Marie Calenders was recommened to us (its right next to hotel) and the food was terrible not sure why it was recommended to us. I also think dogs had been the the room we rented because it smelled of pet dander. So we had to battle dog smell or bird smell, tough choice.

Stayed here several times since they remodeled the rooms and we loved it. This time though it was a different story. The bath had soap scum and hair everywhere. And the nasty carpets ! I'm sure they haven't been shampooed since the remodel last year. Dull, stains and a general appearance of dirty left us disappointed. They need to shut down a block of rooms every week and do a thorough cleaning of the carpets. We'll probably stay somewhere else next time.
reviews.title: Downhill again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at this beautiful hotel! We came for our 21st Anniversary and were surprised to find the wonderful bottle of Champagne in our room to start our celebration off right. Thank you Emily for the requested room - it was beautiful! Thanks also to the very accomodating front desk. We will be back!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel & Location

reviews.text: Matt and Michele W.
reviews.title: Relaxing fun for you AND your dogs!

reviews.text: We chose this place because it was on the beach and very dog-friendly. Loved it. Staff was terrific, room sparkling clean and the price reasonable considering the location and amenities offered. Pismo's a bit young and touristy for us, but no matter, the beach was lovely and provided miles of fun hiking with the dogs. Great for a short get-away from N Cal.
reviews.title: What a hotel!

description: Located on a 5-acre oceanfront bluff top our iconic hotel features direct access to the beach, outdoor heated pool and three hot-tubs. All retro-modern rooms have latest the amenities and technology, including Free WiFi, iPod docking stations, flat-panel HDTVs with DirecTV,complimentary Continental Breakfast and 7,000 sq. ft. of meeting and event space including our roof top terrace with spectacular views.
